## CB has *goals* 
:::{.nonincremental}

## The conservation thinking
:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
**John Muir** (1838-1914)

The "father" of the Yosemite National Park, USA.

<img src="https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/a0fa94ab6a6045640b61e47f55f9f15ce5eee9f8/0_41_2384_1430/master/2384.jpg?width=620&quality=85&auto=format&fit=max&s=9d713445ee714f7c654a9a53ab925dd6" width= 500>

::: {.column width="40%"}
:::{.fragment}

[Now worldwide in-famous by his racist views](https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2020/jul/23/john-muir-sierra-club-apologizes-for-racist-views)

::: {style="font-size: 80%;"}

:::

## Today's reviews
- The origins fo Conservation Biology is deeply linked to an utilitarian and biased view of nature (social class, gender, western)
- The salient feature of CB is the strong focus on area-based conservation approaches
- The efficiency of this approach is questioned, though some achievements
- There is a need to move forward
